nameEntry.part: Australian Parliament Apology to Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants

biogHist.abstract: On 16 November 2009, the Australian Parliament issued an apology to Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Child and Youth Migration to Western Australia (1913 - 1968)
Inquiry into the Implementation of the Recommendations of the Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Reports (2008 - 2009)
Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care, Parliament of Australia (2003 - 2005)

descriptiveNote.p: The Apology on 16 November 2009 was an endorsement of Recommendation 1 from the 'Forgotten Australians' report of the Inquiry into Institutional Care.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants oral history project [sound recording], National Library of Australia (2009 - 2012)

descriptiveNote.p: Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants oral history project received funding following the Australian Parliament Apology to Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants.

archref.abstract: 'Prime Minister says sorry' is a video of the Prime Minister Kevin Rudd giving a national apology to the Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants in the Great Hall of Parliament House in Canberra.
